´´ actually, it just adds blending passes to the model edges.... only multisampling. supersampling, in contrast, renders the scene internally at a higher resolution, and then downsamples it to the output resolution. supersampling is by far the best method of anti-aliasing in terms of image quality, but the performance hit tends to be massive. as such, it´s not used much; multisampling is much more common. sweet, it´s always good to learn something new ;)

´´ actually, it just adds blending passes to the model edges.... only multisampling. supersampling, in contrast, renders the scene internally at a higher resolution, and then downsamples it to the output resolution. supersampling is by far the best method of anti-aliasing in terms of image quality, but the performance hit tends to be massive. as such, it´s not used much; multisampling is much more common. sweet, it´s always good to learn something new ;)
